lines.gurmukhi: 1 KStm gur mMglw crx
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: Awid purKu Awdysu kir Awid purK Awdysu krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Kari Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru bowed before the Lord and the primal Lord made the whole world bow before the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: eykMkwr Akwr kir guru goivMdu nwau sdvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aykankaar Akaaru Kari Guru Govindu Naau Sadavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The formless Brahm assuming (human) form has got himself called Guru (Har) Gobind.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHm inrgux srgux AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Niragoun Saragoun Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Assuming form and being formless at the same time, the transcendental perfect Brahm has made His unmanifest form manifest.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq AwrwiDAw Bgiq vClu hoie AClu ClwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Aaraadhiaa Bhagati Vachhalu Hoi Achhalu Chhalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The holy congregation adored Him; and being in love with the devotees He, the undeceivable, got deluded (and became manifest in the form of Guru).

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwr Akwr kir iek kvwau pswau pswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaar Akaar Kari Iku Kavaau Pasaau Pasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Maar assuming form created the whole world by His one commanding vibration.

lines.gurmukhi: rom rom ivic riKEnu kir bHmMfu kroiV smwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Rom Rom Vichi Rakhiaonu Kari Brahamandu Karorhi Samaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In His each trichome He contained millions of universes.

lines.gurmukhi: swD jnw gur crn iDAwieAw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Janaa Gur Charan Dhiaaiaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The sadhus adore the Lord in the form of the Guru's feet.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 gurmuK mwrg

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of the gurumukh

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrig pYru Dir dihidis bwrh vwt n DwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Maaragi Pairu Dhari Dahidisi Baarah Vaat N Dhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The guru-oriented treading the path leading towards the Guru does not stray into the paths of the twelve sects of the yogis.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmUriq gur iDAwnu Dir Git Git pUrn bHmu idKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Moorati Gur Dhiaanu Dhari Ghati Ghati Pooran Braham Dikhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Concentrating on the form of Guru i.e. Word of the Guru, he adopts it in life and comes face to :face with the perfect Brahm.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq aupdysu ilv pwrbHm gur igAwnu jxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Oupadaysu Liv Paarabraham Gur Giaanu Janaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Concentration of consciousness on the word of the Guru and knowledge bestowed by the Guru provides the awareness about the transcendental Brahm .

lines.gurmukhi: islw AlUxI ctxI crx kvl crxodku ipAwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Silaa Aloonee Chatanee Charan Kaval Charanodaku Piaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only such a persen quaffs the nectar of feet-wash of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq inhclu icq kir suK sMpt ivic inj Gru CwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Nihachalu Chitu Kari Soukh Sanpat Vichi Nij Gharu Chhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This however is nothing less than licking of the tasteless stone. He stablizes his mind in the wisdom of the Guru and reclines comfortably in the chamber of his inner self.

lines.gurmukhi: pr qn pr Dn prhry pwrs pris Aprsu rhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Par Tan Par Dhan Paraharay Paarasi Parasi Aparasu Rahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Touching the philosopher's stone in the form of the Guru , he repudiating the wealth and physical body of others remains detached from all.

lines.gurmukhi: swiD AswiD swD sMig AwieAw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Asaadhi Saadh Sangi Aaiaa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: For curing his chronic maladies (of evil propensities) he goes to the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 gurmuKwN dI ibDI

Shabad OS B.translation: Uplift of the gurmukhs

lines.gurmukhi: ijau vV bIau sjIau hoie kir ivsQwru ibrKu aupjwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Varh Beeu Sajeeu Hoi Kari Visadaaru Birakhu Oupajaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the seed of banyan tree getting developed extends itself in the form of a large tree

lines.gurmukhi: ibrKhu hoie shMs Pl Pl Pl ivic bhu bIA smwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Birakhahu Hoi Sahans Phal Phal Phal Vichi Bahu Beea Samaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And then on that very tree grow thousands of fruits containing myriad seeds (likewise gurmukh makes others like his own self).

lines.gurmukhi: duqIAw cMdu Agws ijau Awid purK Awdysu krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Douteeaa Chandu Agaas Jiu Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That primal Lord, like the second day's moon in the sky, gets himself worshipped iby one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: qwry mMfl sMq jn Drm swl scKMf vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Taaray Mandalu Sant Jan Dharamasaal Sach Khand Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The saints are constellation inhabiting the abode of truth in the form of religious places.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie Awpu gvwie n Awpu jxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paakhaak Hoi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Janaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They bowing at the feet and becoming dust of , the feet lose there ego and never allow themselves to be noticed by any one.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu DRU ijvY inhcl vws Agwsu cVHwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Dhr Jivai Nihachal Vaasu Agaasu Charhhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Attainer of the pleasure fruit, the gurmukh lives steadfastly like the pole star in the sky.

lines.gurmukhi: sB qwry cauPyir iPrwieAw ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Taaray Chaudhayri Dhiraaiaa ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: All the stars revolve around him.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 Bgq nwmdyv

Shabad OS B.translation: Namdev, the saint

lines.gurmukhi: nwmw CINbw AwKIAY gurmuiK Bwie Bgiq ilv lweI
lines.transliteration_english: Naamaa Chheenbaa Aakheeai Guramoukhi Bhaai Bhagati Liv Laaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Namdev, the calico minter having become gurmukh merged his consciousness in loving devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: KqRI bHmx dyhurY auqm jwiq krin vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Khatree Braahaman Dayhurai Outam Jaati Karani Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: High caste kshatriyas and Brahmins who went to temple to eulogize the Lord caught hold and ousted Namdev.

lines.gurmukhi: nwm pkiV auTwilAw bih ipCvwVY hir gux gweI
lines.transliteration_english: Naamaa Pakarhi Outdaaliaa Bahi Pachhavaarhai Hari Goun Gaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: While sitting in the back yard of the temple, he started singing the praises of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgq vCl AwKwiedw Pyir dyhurw pYij rKweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagat Vachhalu Aakhaaidaa Dhayri Dayhuraa Paiji Rakhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord known as kind to devotees turned the face of the temple towards him and maintained His own reputation.

lines.gurmukhi: drgh mwxu inmwixAw swDsMgiq siqgur srxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Daragah Maanu Nimaaniaa Saadhasangati Satigur Saranaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the shelter of  holy congregation, the true Guru and the Lord, the humble ones also get honour.

lines.gurmukhi: auqmu pdvI nIc jwiq cwry vrx pey pg AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Outamu Padavee Neech Jaati Chaaray Varan Paay Pagi Aaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: High, ranking as well as the so-called low castes i.e. all the four as fell at the feet of Namdev

lines.gurmukhi: ijau nIvwix nIru cil jweI ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Neevaani Neeru Chali Jaaee ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the water flows down towards low

lines.gurmukhi: 5 BgqwN dI jwq nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: The saints have no caste

lines.gurmukhi: Asur BBIKxu Bgqu hY ibdru DRU ivKlI srxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Asur Bhabheekhanu Bhagatu Hai Bidaru Su Vikhalee Pat Saranaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Saint Vibhisaa a demon, and Vidur son of maid servant came in the shelter of the Lord. Dhanni is known as a jai

lines.gurmukhi: DMnw jtu vKwxIAY sDnw jwiq Ajwiq ksweI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannaa Jatu Vakhaaneeai Sadhanaa Jaati Ajaati Kasaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: And Sadhana was an out caste butcher. Saint Kabir was a weaver

lines.gurmukhi: Bgqu kbIr julwhVw nwmw CINbw hir gux gweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagatu Kabeeru Julaaharhaa Naamaa Chheenbaa Hari Goun Gaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: And Namdev a calicoprinter who sang the praises of the Lord. Ravidas was a cobbler and saint Sairt belonged to (the so-called ) low barber caste.

lines.gurmukhi: kuil rivdwsu cmwru hY sYxu snwqI AMdir nweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kuli Ravidaasu Chamaaru Hai Sainu Sanaatee Andari Naaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Female crow takes care of the fledgelings of nightingale but they ultimately meet their own family.

lines.gurmukhi: koiel pwlY kwvxI AMiq imlY Apxy kul jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Koil Paalai Kaavanee Anti Milai Apanay Kul Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though Yagoda nurtured Krsna, yet he came to be known as the lotus (son) ) of the family of Vasudev.

lines.gurmukhi: iksnu jsoDw pwilAw vwsdyv kul kvl sdweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kisanu Jasodhaa Paaliaa Vaasadayv Kul Kaval Sadaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the pot of any type containing ghee is not said to be bad,

lines.gurmukhi: iGA BwNfw n vIcwrIAY Bgqw jwiq snwq n kweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ghia Bhaandaa N Vichaareeai Bhagataa Jaati Sanaati N Kaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, the saints also have no high or low caste whatsoever.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl siqgur srxweI ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Satigur Saranaaee ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: They all remain in the shelter of the lotus feet of the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 nIc QwEN au`qm vsqwN dy diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Examples of the lowly places and the best articles

lines.gurmukhi: fymUM KKir imsrI mKI mylu mKIru aupwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Daymoon Khakhari Misaree Makhee Maylu Makheeru Oupaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From hornets' nest lump sugar and by honey bees the honey hive is produced.

lines.gurmukhi: pwt ptMbir kIiVAhu kuit kit sxu ikrqwsu bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paat Patanbar Keerhiahu Kouti Kati Sanu Kirataasu Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From worms is produced silk and by pounding the hemp, paper is prepared.

lines.gurmukhi: mlml hoie vVyivAhu ickiV kvlu Bvru loBwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Malamal Hoi Varhayviahu Chikarhi Kavalu Bhavaru Lobhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Muslin is prepared from cotton seed and in the mire grows the lotus on the black bee gets enamoured.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau mix kwly sp isir pQru hIry mwxk CwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Mani Kaalay Sap Siri Padaru Heeray Maanak Chhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A gem remains in the hood of black snake  and among the stones are found diamonds and rubies.

lines.gurmukhi: jwxu kQUrI imrg qin nwau BgauqI lohu GVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jaanu Kadooree Mirag Tani Naau Bhagaoutee Lohu Gharhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The musk is found in the navel of deer and from ordinary iron the powerful sword is aced.

lines.gurmukhi: musku iblIAhu mydu kir mjls AMdir mh mhkwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Mousaku Bileeahu Maydu Kari Majalas Andari Mah Mahakaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The brain marrow of musk cat makes the whole gethering fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: nIc join auqmu Plu pwieAw ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Neech Joni Outamu Phalu Paaiaa ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus the creatures and materials of lower species give and attain the highest fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 rwjw bil dw pRsMg

Shabad OS B.translation: Tale of Bali, the King

lines.gurmukhi: bil poqw piHlwd dw ieMdr purI dI ieC ieCMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Bali Potaa Prahilaad Daa Indar Puree Dee Ichh Ichhandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Son of Virochan and grand son of Prahalad, king Bali, had a desire of ruling the abode of Indr.

lines.gurmukhi: kir sMpUrxu jgu sau iek iekoqru jgu krMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Sanpooranu Jagu Sau Ik Ikotaru Jagu Karandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He had accomplished hundred yajns (burnt  offerings) and his other hudred yajns were in progress.

lines.gurmukhi: bwvn rUpI Awie kY grbu invwir Bgq auDrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Baavan Roopee Aai Kai Garabu Nivaari Bhagat Udharandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lord in the form of a dwarf came to remove his ego and thus liberated him.

lines.gurmukhi: ieMdRwsx no prhrY jwie pqwil su hukmI bMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Indraasan No Paraharai Jaai Pataali Su Houkamee Bandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He repudiated the throne of Indr and like an obedient servant went to the nether world.

lines.gurmukhi: bil Cil Awpu ClwieEnu drvwjy drvwn hovMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Bali Chhali Aapu Chhalaaiaonu Daravaajay Daravaan Hovandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord Himself got enamoured of Bali and had to stay as a door keeper of Bali.

lines.gurmukhi: sÍwNiq bUMd lY isp ijau moqI cuBI mwir suhMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Saati Boond Lai Sip Jiu Motee Choubhee Maari Suhandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bali, the king is like that shell which in the svati naksatr (a special star formation) receiving a drop and making it a pearl dives deep at the bottom of the sea.

lines.gurmukhi: hIrY hIrw byiD imlMdw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Heerai Heeraa Baydhi Miladaa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: The diamond heart of devotee Bali, cut by the diamond Lord was finally subsumed in Him.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 kIVI

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of an ant

lines.gurmukhi: nIchu nIc sdwvxw kIVI hoie n Awpu gxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Neechahu Neech Sadaavanaa Keerhee Hoi N Aapu Ganaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ants never make themselves noticed and are known lowest among the lowly.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrig clxw iekqu Kfu shMs smwey
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Maaragi Chalanaa Ikatu Khadu Sahans Samaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They follow the path of gurmukhs and due to their broad mindedness they live in thousands, in a small hole.

lines.gurmukhi: iGA skr dI vws lY ijQY DrI iqQY cil jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Ghia Sakar Dee Vaasu Lai Jidai Dharee Tidai Chali Jaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only by smelling ghee and sugar, they reach the place where these things are kept (gurmukhs also search out he holy congregations).

lines.gurmukhi: fulY KMfu ju ryq ivic KMfU dwxw cuix cuix Kwey
lines.transliteration_english: Dulai Khandu Ju Raytu Vichi Khandoo Daanaa Chouni Chouni Khaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They pick up the sugar bits scattered in sand similarly as a gurmukh  cherishes the virtues.

lines.gurmukhi: BiRMgI dy BY jwie mir hovY BiRMgI mwir jIvwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhringee Day Bhai Jaai Mari Hovai Bhringee Maari Jeevaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dying of the fear of worm bhringi the ant itself becomes bhringi and makes others also like itself.

lines.gurmukhi: AMfw kCU kUMj dw Awsw ivic inrwsu vlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Andaa Kachhoo Koonj Daa Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like the eggs of heron and tortoise, it (ant) remains detached amidst hopes.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK gurisKu suK Pl pwey ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Gurasikhu Soukh Phalu Paaay ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly gurmukhs also getting educated attain the pleasure fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 in`ky hox pur lok pRis`D pRsMg

Shabad OS B.translation: Many a story of becoming humble

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj pwis ibAwsu jwie hoie Buxhxw kMin smwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraj Paasi Biaasu Jaai Hoi Bhounahanaa Kanni Samaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rishi Vyas went to sun and becoming a small insect entered into his ear i.e. most humbly he remained with him and got educated by sun).

lines.gurmukhi: pViH ividAw Gir AwieAw gurmuiK bwlmIk min Bwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Parhhi Vidiaa Ghari Aaiaa Guramoukhi Baalameek Mani Bhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Valmiki also only becoming guru- oriented attained knowledge and then he returned home.

lines.gurmukhi: Awid ibAws vKwxIAY kiQ kiQ swsqR vyd purwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Biaas Vakhaaneeai Kadi Kadi Saasatr Vayd Puraanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The exponent of many stories of the Vedas, Shastras and the Puranas Valmili is known as the primal poet.

lines.gurmukhi: nwrid muin aupdyisAw Bgiq Bwgvqu pViH pqIAwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Naaradi Mouni Oupadaysiaa Bhagati Bhaagavatu Parhhi Pateeaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sage Narad  preached to him and only after reading the Blia-gavat of devotion he could attain peace.

lines.gurmukhi: caudh ividAw soiDkY praupkwru Acwru suKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaudah Vidiaa Sodhi Kai Paraoupakaaru Achaaru Soukhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He researched  the fourteen skills but ultimately he got happiness due to his benevolent conduct.

lines.gurmukhi: praupkwrI swDsMgu piqq auDwrxu ibrdu vKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Paraoupakaaree Saadhasangu Patit Udhaaranu Biradu Vakhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Association with such humble sadhus is altruistic and makes one habitual liberates of the fallen ones.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu piq prvwxw ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Pati Paravaanaa ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs attain pleasure fruits in it and get dignified acceptance in the court of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 sukdyv

Shabad OS B.translation: Sukadev

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh vrHy grBwis vis jMmdy hI suik leI audwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Varhay Garabhaasi Vasi Jamaday Hee Souki Laee Udaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having remained in his mother's womb for twelve years, Sukadev adopted  detachedness right form the very time of his birth.

lines.gurmukhi: mwieAw ivic AqIq hoie mn hT buiD n bMidKlwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Maaiaa Vichi Ateet Hoi Man Hatd Budhi N Bandi Khalaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though he went beyond  maya yet because of his intellect pushed by stubbornness of mind, he could not attain liberation.

lines.gurmukhi: ipqw ibAws prboiDAw gur kir jnk shj AiBAwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Pia Biaas Parabodhiaa Gur Kari Janak Sahaj Abhiaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His father Vyas made him understand that he should adopt king Janak as his guru who is well grounded in the art of remaining in equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: qij durmiq gurmiq leI isr Dir jUiT imlI swbwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Taji Duramati Guramati Laee Sir Dhari Jootdi Milee Saabaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Doing so, and divesting himself of the evil wisdom,he acquired he wisdom of Guru and as ordered by his guru he carried left overs on his head and thus earned pats from the guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdysu Avysu kir grib invwir jgiq gurdwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Guraoupadaysu Avaysu Kari Garabi Nivaari Jagati Guradaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When inspired by the teachings f the guru he repudiated ego, the whole world accepted him as guru and  became his servant .

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie gurmiq Bwau Bgiq prgwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Guramati Bhaau Bhagati Paragaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: By falling at the feet, by becoming dust of the feet and by the wisdom of the guru, loving devotion came up in him.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu shj invwsI ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Sahaj Nivaasee ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: As a gurmukh attaining pleasure fruit he got himself lodged in equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 gur is`KwN dI ivSyKqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Virtues of the Sikhs of Guru

lines.gurmukhi: rwju jogu hY jnk dy vfw Bgqu kir vyd vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Raaj Jogu Hai Janak Day Vadaa Bhagatu Kari Vaydu Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Janak is a king as well as a yogi and the books of knowledge describe him as great devotee.

lines.gurmukhi: snkwidk nwrd audws bwl suBwie AqIqu suhwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sanakaadik Naarad Udaas Baal Soubhaai Ateetu Suhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sanaks and Narad from their very childhood were of detached nature and adorned themselves with indifference to all.

lines.gurmukhi: jog Bog lK lMiG kY guru isK swDsMgiq inrbwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Jog Bhog Lakh Laghi Kai Gurasikh Saadhasangati Nirabaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Going beyond millions of detachments and enjoyments, the Sikhs of Guru also remain humble m the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gxwie ivgucxw Awpu gvwey Awpu is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Ganaai Vigouchanaa Aapu Gavaaay Aapu Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who gets himself counted or noticed goes astray in illusions; but he who loses his ego infact identifies his self.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrgu sc dw pYrI pvxw rwjy rwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Maaragu Sach Daa Pairee Pavanaa Raajay Raanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh' s way is the way of truth whereby all the kings and emperors fall on his feet.

lines.gurmukhi: grbu gumwnu ivswirkY gurmiq irdY grIbI AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Garabu Goumaanu Visaari Kai Guramati Ridai Gareebee Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Treader of this path, forgetting his ego and pride cherishes humility in his heart through the wisdom of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: scI drgh mwxu inmwxY ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Sachee Daragah Maanu Nimaanai ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such an humble person gets respects and regards in the true court.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 crxoidk ivSyKqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Virtues of the feet wash

lines.gurmukhi: isru aucw AiBmwnu ivic kwlK BirAw kwly vwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Siru Ouchaa Abhimaanu Vichi Kaalakh Bhariaa Kaalay Vaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Proud head remains erect and high yet it is coveved by the blackness of hair.

lines.gurmukhi: Brvty kwlK Bry ippxIAwN kwlK sUrwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Bharavatay Kaalakh Bharay Pipaneeaa Kaalakh Sooraalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eyebrows are full of blackness and the eye lashes are also like black thorns.

lines.gurmukhi: loiex kwly jwxIAin dwVI muCw kir muh kwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Loin Kaalay Jaaneeani Daarhee Mouchhaa Kari Muh Kaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eyes are black (in India) and like wise beards and moustaches are also black.

lines.gurmukhi: nk AMdir nk vwl bhu lUMie lUMie kwlK byqwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Nak Andari Nak Vaal Bahu Looi Looi Kaalakh Baytaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many trichomes are there in the nose and all of them are black.

lines.gurmukhi: aucY AMg n pUjIAin crx DUiV gurmuiK Drmswlw
lines.transliteration_english: Ouchai Ang N Poojeeani Charan Dhoorhi Guramoukhi Dharamasaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Organs placed higher are not worshipped and the dust of the feet of gurmukhs  is adorable like holy places .

lines.gurmukhi: pYrw nK muK aujly Bwru aucwiein dyhu durwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Pairaa Nakh Moukh Ujalay Bhaaru Ouchaaini Dayhu Duraalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Feet and nails are blessed because they carry`the load of the whole body.

lines.gurmukhi: isr Dovxu Apiv`qR hY gurmuiK crxodk jg Bwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Sir Dhovanu Apavitr Hai Guramoukhi Charanodak Jagi Bhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The head wash is considered dirty but the feet wash of the gurmukhs is sought after by the whole world.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl shju suKwlw ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Sahaju Soukhaalaa ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Attaining the pleasure fruit the gurmukhs in their equipoise, remain as the store house of all delights.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 eISÍrIX rcnw

Shabad OS B.translation: Godly creation

lines.gurmukhi: jl ivic DrqI Drmswl DrqI AMdir nIr invwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Vichi Dharatee Dharamasaal Dharatee Andari Neer Nivaasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Earth, the abode for the conduct of dharma is supported by water and inside earth,too, resides water.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl srxwgqI inhcl DIrju Drmu suvwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Saranaagatee Nihachal Dheeraju Dharamu Suvaasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Coming into the shelter of the lotus feet (of the Guru), the earth is pervaded by the fragrance of firm fortitude, and dharma.

lines.gurmukhi: ikrK ibrK kusmwvlI bUtI jVI Gwh Aibnwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Kirakh Birakh Kousamaavalee Bootee Jarhee Ghaah Abinaasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On it (earth) grow trees, lines of flowers, herbs and grass which never exhaust.

lines.gurmukhi: sr swier igir myru bhu rqn pdwrQ Bog iblwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Sar Saair Giri Mayru Bahu Ratan Padaarad Bhog Bilaasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many a pond, ocean, mountain, jewel and pleasure giving material are there on it.

lines.gurmukhi: dyv sQl qIrQ Gxy rMg rUp rs ks prgwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Dayv Sadal Teerad Ghanay Rang Roop Ras Ras Paragaasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many godly places, pilgrimage centres, hues, forms, edibles and inedibles come forth from it.

lines.gurmukhi: gur cyly rhrwis kir gurmuiK swDsMgiq guxqwsw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Chaylay Raharaasi Kari Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Gounataasaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Owing to the tradition of the Guru-disciple, the holy congregation of the gurmukhs is also a similar ocean of virtues.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu Aws inrwsw ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Aas Niraasaa ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Remaining detached amidst hopes and desires is the pleasure fruit for the gurmukhs.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 swD crx pUjw

Shabad OS B.translation: Worship of the feet of sadhu

lines.gurmukhi: rom rom ivic riKEnu kir bHmMf kroiV smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Rom Rom Vichi Rakhiaonu Kari Brahamand Karorhi Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord has subsumed crores of universes in His each trichome.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHmu pUrn bHmu siq purK siqgur suKdweI
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Sati Purakh Satiguru Soukhadaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru form of that primal perfect and transcendental Brahm is bestower of delights.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrn gurisK hoie swDsMgiq siqgur srxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varan Gurasikh Hoi Saadhasangati Satigur Saranaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the four vamas come to the shelter of the true Guru in the form of holy congregation

lines.gurmukhi: igAwn iDAwn ismrix sdw gurmuiK sbid suriq ilv lweI
lines.transliteration_english: Giaan Dhiaan Simarani Sadaa Guramoukhi Sabadi Suratili Valaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: And the gurmukhs there merge their consciousness in the Word through learning, meditation and, prayer.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwie Bgiq Bau iprm rs siqguru mUriq irdy vsweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaai Bhagati Bhau Piram Ras Satiguru Moorati Riday Vasaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fear of the Lord, loving devotion and the delight of love, for them, is the idol of the true Guru whom they cherish in their heart.

lines.gurmukhi: eyvfu Bwru aucwieNdy swD crx pUjw gur BweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ayvadu Bhaaru Ouchaaiday Saadh Charan Poojaa Gur Bhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The feet of the true Guru in the form of sadhu bear so much load (mental as well as spiritual) of their disciples that,

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu kIm n pweI ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Keem N Paaee ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: 0 my brothers you, ought to worship them. The value of the pleasure fruit of the gunnukhs cannot be estimated.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 AnRXweI rwjy

Shabad OS B.translation: Unjust kings

lines.gurmukhi: vsY Chbr lwiekY prnwlIN huie vIhIN AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Vasai Chhahabar Laai Kai Paranaaleen Hui Veeheen Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When it rains cats and dogs, the water flowing through gargoyles comes down in the streets.

lines.gurmukhi: lK nwly auCl clin lK prvwhI vwh vhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Naalay Ouchhal Chalani Lakh Paravaahee Vaah Vahaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of streams overflowing become millions of currents.

lines.gurmukhi: lK nwly lK vwih vih ndIAw AMdir rly rlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Naalay Lakh Vaahi Vahi Nadeeaa Andari Ralay Ralaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of rivulets join the currents of rivers.

lines.gurmukhi: nau sY ndI niVMnvY pUrib pCim hoie clwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Nau Sai Nadee Narhinnavai Poorabi Pachhami Hoi Chalaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nine hundred and ninety nine rivers flow in the east and the west directions.

lines.gurmukhi: ndIAw jwie smuMd ivic swgr sMgmu hoie imlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Nadeeaa Jaai Samound Vichi Saagar Sangamu Hoi Milaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rivers go to meet the sea.

lines.gurmukhi: siq smuMd gVwV mih jwie smwih n pytu BrwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sati Samound Garhaarh Mahi Jaai Samaahi N Paytu Bharaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seven such seas merge into the oceans but still the oceans are not satiated.

lines.gurmukhi: jwie gVwVu pqwl hyiT hoie qvy dI bUMd smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaai Garhaarhu Pataal Haytdi Hoi Tavay Dee Boond Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the nether world, such oceans also look like a drop of water on a hot plate.

lines.gurmukhi: isr piqswhw lK lK ieMnxu jwil qvy no qwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sir Patisaahaan Lakh Lakh Innanu Jaali Tavay No Taavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: To heat this plate, millions of heads of the emperors are used as fuel.

lines.gurmukhi: mrdy Kih Kih dunIAw dwvY ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Maraday Khahi Khahi Douneeaa Daavai ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: And these emperors staking their claims on this earth go on fighting and dying.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 do pwqSwh-vIh PkIr

Shabad OS B.translation: Two Kings and twenty faquirs -

lines.gurmukhi: iekqu QykY duie KVgu duie pwqswh n mulik smwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Ikatu Daykai Dui Kharhagu Dui Paatisaah N Mulaki Samaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In one sheath two swords and two emperors in one country cannot be accommodated;

lines.gurmukhi: vIh PkIr msIiq ivic iKMQ iKMDolI hyiT lukwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Dhakeer Maseeti Vichi Khind Khindholee Haytdi Loukaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: But twenty faquirs in one mosque under one patched blanket can remain (comfortably).

lines.gurmukhi: jMgl AMdir sIh duie posq fofy KsKs dwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Jangal Andari Seeh Dui Posat Doday Khasakhas Daanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Emperors are like two lions in a jungle whereas the faquirs are like the opium seeds in one pod.

lines.gurmukhi: sUlI aupir Kylxw isir Dir CqR bjwr ivkwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Soolee Oupari Khaylanaa Siri Dhari Chhatr Bajaar Vikaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: These seeds play on the 'bed of thorns before they get the honour of selling in the market.

lines.gurmukhi: kolU AMdir pIVIAin posiq pIih ipAwly CwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Koloo Andari Peerheeani Posati Peehi Piaalay Chhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: They are rushed in the press with water before they are strained into the cup .

lines.gurmukhi: laubwlI drgwh ivic grbu gunwhI mwxu inmwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Laoubaalee Daragaah Vichi Garabu Gounaahee Maanu Nimaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the court of the fearless Lord, the proud ones are called sinners and the humble get respects and regards.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK hoNdy qwix inqwxY ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Honday Taani Nitaanai ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: That is why the gurmukhs though powerful behave as the meek ones.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 b`krI

Shabad OS B.translation: She goat

lines.gurmukhi: sIh pjUqI bkrI mrdI hoeI hV hV hsI
lines.transliteration_english: Seeh Pajootee Bakaree Maradee Hoee Harh Harh Hasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: A goat was caught by a lion and while about to die, it gave out a horse­ laugh.

lines.gurmukhi: sIhu puCY ivsmwdu hoie iequ Aausr ikqu rhis rhsI
lines.transliteration_english: Seehu Pouchhai Visamaadu Hoi Itu Aousari Kitu Rahasi Rahasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The surprised lion asked why it was so happy at such a moment (of its death).

lines.gurmukhi: ibnau kryNdI bkrI puqR Aswfy kIcin KsI
lines.transliteration_english: Binau Karayndee Bakaree Poutr Asaaday Keechani Khasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Humbly the goat replied that the testicals of our male progeny are crushed in order to castrate them.

lines.gurmukhi: Ak DqUrw KwiDAw kuih kuih Kl auKil ivxsI
lines.transliteration_english: Ak Dhatooraa Khaadhiaan Kuhi Kuhi Khal Oukhali Vinasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: We eat only wild plants of arid regions yet our skin is peeled and pounded.

lines.gurmukhi: mwsu Kwin gl viFkY hwlu iqnwVw kauxu hovsI
lines.transliteration_english: Maasu Khaani Gal Vaddhi Kai Haalu Tinaarhaa Kaounu Hovasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: I think about the plight of those (like you) who cut the throat of others and eat their flesh.

lines.gurmukhi: grbu grIbI dyh Kyh Kwju AKwju Akwju krsI
lines.transliteration_english: Garabu Gareebee Dayh Khayh Khaaju Akhaaju Akaaju Karasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The body of both of the proud and the humble will become dust ultimately, but, even then the body of the arrogant (lion) is inedible and that of the humble (goat) attaims the status of edible.

lines.gurmukhi: jig AwieAw sB koie mrsI ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Jagi Aaiaa Sabh Koi Marasee ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: All who came to this world have to die ultimately.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl rhrwis kir gurmuiK swDsMgiq prgwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Raharaasi Kari Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Paragaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: By remaining in and around the lotus feet, the gurmukh receives the light of the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie lyK AlyK Amr AibnwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paakhaak Hoi Laykh Alaykh Amar Abinaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Worshipping the feet and becoming the dust of the feet one becomes detached , immortal and indestructible .

lines.gurmukhi: kir crxodku Awcmn AwiD ibAwiD aupwiD KlwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Charanodaku Aachamaan Aadhi Biaadhi Oupaadhi Khalaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Drinking the ash of the feet of gurmukhs, freedom from all physical mental and spiritual ailments is attained.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq Awpu gvwieAw mwieAw AMdir krin audwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Aapu Gavaaiaa Maaiaa Andari Karani Udaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through the wisdom of the Guru they lose, their ego and do not get absorbed in maya.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilvlIxu hoie inrMkwr scKMif invwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Livaleenu Hoi Nirankaar Sach Khandi Nivaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Absorbing their consciousness in the word, they reside in the true abode (holy congregation) of the formless one.

lines.gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq AgwiD boiD AkQ kQw Acrj gurdwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Abigati Gati Agaadhi Bodhi Akad Kadaa Acharaj Guradaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tale of the servants of the Lord is unfathomable ineffable and Manifest.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu Aws inrwsI ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Aas Niraasee ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Remaining indifferent to hopes is the pleasure fruit of the Gurmukhs.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 siqsMg inrdoK qwrdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Holy congregation liberates even the knaves

lines.gurmukhi: sx vx vwVI Kyqu ieku praupkwru ivkwr jxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: San Van Vaarhee Khaytu Iku Paraoupakaaru Vikaaru Janaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hemp and cotton grow in the same field but the use of one is benevolent while the other one is put to evil use.

lines.gurmukhi: Kl kFwih vtwie sx rsw bMDnu hoie bnHwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Khal Kaddhaahi Vataai San Rasaa Bandhanu Hoi Banhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: After peeling off the hemp plant rope is made whose nooses are used to tie people in bondage.

lines.gurmukhi: Kwsw mlml isrIswPu sUqu kqwie kpwh vuxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Khaasaa Malamal Sireesaadhu Sootu Kataai Kapaah Vounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: On the other hand, from cotton are made coarse cloth muslin and sirisaf.

lines.gurmukhi: ljxu kjxu hoie kY swDu AswDu ibrdu ibrdwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Lajanu Kajanu Hoi Kai Saadhu Asaadhu Biradu Biradaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cotton in the form of cloth covers the modesty of others and protects the dharma of sadhus as well as wicked persons.

lines.gurmukhi: sMg doK inrdoK moK sMg suBwau n swDu imtwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sang Dokh Niradokh Mokh Sang Soubhaau N Saadhu Mitaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sadhus even when they associate with the evil never repudiate their saintly nature.

lines.gurmukhi: qRpVu hovY Drmswl swDsMgiq pg DUiV DumwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Traparhu Hovai Dharamasaal Saadhasangati Pag Dhoorhi Dhoumaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the hemp transformed into coarse cloth is brought to the holy places for spreading in the holy congregation, it also becomes blest after coming in touch with the dust of the feet of the sadhus.

lines.gurmukhi: kuit kuit sx ikrqwsu kir hir jsu iliK purwx sunwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kati Kouti San Kirataasu Kari Hari Jasu Likhi Puraan Sounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Also, when after getting a thorough beating paper is made of it, the holy men write praises of the Lord.on it and recite the same for others.

lines.gurmukhi: piqq punIqu krY jn BwvY ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Patit Pouneet Karai Jan Bhaavai ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: The holy congregation makes the fallen ones also  holy.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 sMgq gux

Shabad OS B.translation: virtues of the holy congregation

lines.gurmukhi: pQr icqu kToru hY cUnwN hovY AgI dDw
lines.transliteration_english: Padar Chitu Katdoru Hai Choonaa Hovai Ageen Dadhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the hard hearted stone is burnt, it turns into lime stone. sprinkling of  water extinguishes fire

lines.gurmukhi: Ag buJY jlu iCVikAY cUnw Aig auTY Aiq vDw
lines.transliteration_english: Ag Bujhai Jalu Chhirhakiai Choonaa Agi Outday Ati Vadhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: But in the case of lime water produces great heat.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI pwey ivhu n jwie Agin n CutY Avgux bDw
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Paaay Vihu N Jaai Agani N Chhoutai Avagoun Badhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its poison does not go away even if water is thrown on it and its foul fire remains in it .

lines.gurmukhi: jIBY auqY riKAw Cwly pvin sMig duK lDw
lines.transliteration_english: Jeebhai Outai Rakhiaa Chhaalay Pavani Sangi Doukh Ladhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If put on tongue, it creates painful blisters.

lines.gurmukhi: pwn supwrI kQu imil rMgu surMgu sMpUrxu sDw
lines.transliteration_english: Paan Soupaaree Kadu Mili Rangu Surangu Sanpooranu Sadhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: But getting company of betel leaf, betel nut and catechu its colour becomes bright, beautiful and completely refined.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq imil swDu hoie gurmuiK mhw AswD smDw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Mili Saadhu Hoi Guramoukhi Mahaa Asaadh Samadhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly joining the holy congregation becoming holy men, the gurmukhs get rid of even the chronic ailments.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie imlY plu ADw ]20]25]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaai Milai Palu Adhaa ?20?25?panjheeha?

Shabad OS B.translation: When the ego is lost, God is visualized even in half a moment.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir ADm AswD swD gurmiq siq kir jMq sMq nwm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Adham Asaadh Saadha , Gurmati Sati Kari Jant Sant Naam Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By adopting and accepting the Guru's word as true and immortal, a lowly and base person can become pious. By concentrating on the precepts of Guru, even a lowly and trivial person can rise to become a holy man.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir AibbykI huie ibbykI gurmiq siq kir kwm inhkwm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Abibaykee Hui Bibaykee , Gurmati Sati Kari Kaam Nihakaam Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The thoughtless and ignorant person becomes rational and considerate once he accepts the truth of Guru's wisdom. He also becomes free from all desires and wants.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir AigAwnI bHmigAwnI gurmiq siq kir shj ibsRwm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Agiaanee Brahamagiaanee , Gurmati Sati Kari Sahaj Bisraam Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who is wandering in the darkness of ignorance becomes a Brahm Gyani once he accepts the truth of Guru's wisdom and teachings. By practicing the teachings of Guru with full devotion and confidence, one reaches a state of equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir jIvn mukiq Bey gurmiq siq kir inhcl Dwm hY ]25]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Jeevan Moukati Bhaay , Gurmati Sati Kari Nihachal Dhaam Hai ?25?

Shabad OS B.translation: By accepting Guru's teachings as true and practicing them with concentration, devotion and faith, one attains salvation when still alive and secures a place in the higher realms of the Lord. (25)
